page.title: 13FRODSHAM HILL RACES
page.content: The hill races as we know them today were started in 1970 as part of carnival week and have proved to be one of the most succcesful events of this type. The races have attracted athletes from all parts of the country, including famous names like Sebastian Coe who competed as a 12 year old in 1972. Records show that hill races have been held in Frodsham for over 100 years and, after lapsing, they have been revived from time to time. In 1980 a ladies' race was introduced for the first time. The Senior Men's race involves 3 hill circuits and a total of over 1000 feet in climbing.
